reviewText:
Early Access Review

as a fan of the steampunk setting, I gave it aq shot and bought the game before knowing much about it, and here is my honest openion.

+ it looks and feels like it is infeluenced by bioshock, but without the focus being on horror, which is ok.
+ quest design has u running around collecting stuff from all over (at least in the first area).
+ an fps with rpg leveling up and crafting, that has good potential with a bit more work.
- the full body emmersion thing is annoying, but can be polished during this early access stage.
- not much weapons (just 3 so far), but as i said before, that can be improved in this stage.
- movment feels sluggish and slow, something that can be tweaked.
- many many bugs and glitches (as expected of early access games)
- the real problem is the lack of direction, i do realize that is likely a design choice, but it did make me spend alot of time running around not knowing what to do or where to go. the frustration emphasized by the slow sluggish movment and the glitches.

when all is said and done, the game has potential, and it is way too early to pass final judgment on it.
so yes, I do recomend it, and support it for it can (and hopfully will) be in the future

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Ahh man, at the time of writing, mixed is all right a grade for the first 10 minutes of playing Avenging Angel.

After considerable deliberation I've decided to give it a thumbs-up cause the genre (FPS exploration/puzzle/adventure) is somewhat unique, premise is intriguing, graphics are so far in a word - lovely, par for the course for a small-team indie Unity effort and all the problems aren't grand and earth-shattering and are solvable before going gold.
But there is so much missing one would consider standard productional polish in the year of our lord 2015. Currently, one can rebind keyboard keys for instance, but solely from the Unity menu outside of the game and tutorial prompts don't reflect the change in-game. Animation is awkward and can be buggy. Jumps propell you backward if you're too close to the wall, like you're a ball. One time I was propelled some 7m in the air while climbing stairs for no apparent reason. And when you crouch, you inexplicably and slowly change your point of view downward. No, thank you, game, I'm perfectly capable of bringing the mouse down if I want to. I. just. Wanna. Crouch. But those are forgiveable things.

The greatest problem is the flavour text found in dialogues and journal. It's badly translated. Yeah, one can determine what the poet wanted to say"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I just did my first playthrough earlier today. It was enjoyable.

Pros
-Fun
-Nice steampunk atmosphere
-Pretty cool robots

Cons
-Bugs
-Clipping
-Needs a bunch of polish

I did not have a gamebreaker bug and I did play through wihout restarting but it was a bit confusing. A map feature is greatly needed. I did very much enjoy the freeroam style but there was little direction. For Early Access it is legit.

There is a conundrum with early access. If you do not support the developers and are rude they will not want to finish the game. I see it happen time after time. A great start flops for no reason when you think about it by negative people who want the moon and stars. If you give support to these guys I believe they will put out something quite nice..

-Aaron
voteText: 6 of 7 people (86%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I appreciate that the game is trying to be similar to the likes of the original Deus Ex and the System/BioShock games, but it clearly needs more work. There's a lot of underpolish and even basic movement is highly questionable right now. I'm not even compelled to try it further than the half-hour I spent.

Putting development priority on gameplay and optimisation rather than making a large world/story would probably help this game immensely. It seems to be too big of a project for its own good.

Since I'm still interested in how the game will turn out, I'm going to keep an eye on the game and change this review accordingly.
voteText: 5 of 6 people (83%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I got this in the Steampunk Groupees Bundle, and I'm glad that I didn't spend money specifically on this game.

The graphics, environments, and setting are great, but those are the only positive things about this game.

From what I've played, both the gameplay and story are complete rubbish.
There are several issues with clipping, particularly when it comes to stairs for some reason. For example, when you get to the mines there's a spiral staircase which I couldn't get down without crouching (which only seems to exist for getting down stairs) and then walking along the rail. The map doesn't really show exactly where you're meant to be heading, so there's a good chance of wandering around for several minutes until you find it. The countrols aren't really explained, so you'd have to check the controls in the options. There's a option to holster your weapons by 'holding' down the Reload button (R), which seems to serve no purpose other than activating around a third of the times you press R to reload and forcing you to run away in a fight whilst you press the button for the weapon you were using.
As for the story, nothing is really explained. The protaganist starts in an airship, is given a secret mission which would be better accomplished by a group rather than a single person, and, up to the part where I just gave up on the game, meets a poorly voiced android who tells him to collect items for them for no given reason. There's no actual explanation as to who the character is or why he's the one given this mission. The only other human I encountered in the game talked as if the protaganist was basically equivalent to a Private in the Inventor's Guild (another concept which isn't explained).

TL;DR version:
Don't buy it. Good concept and graphics, terrible gameplay and story.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Too put it kindly, overambitious.
I got the game as part of a bundle a few months ago, and seeing as it's early access i was letting it simmer in my library until some patches came in. but we're going into month 5 post release very shortly and i just see more issues than a small team can fix at this point without restarting the entrie game from the ground up. It may be time to put in one last patch, drop the retail price to dirt cheap, and get on with the next project.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I cannot recomend this game as it is, might be ok when finished.
There is no key mapping which is a major issue for me. Many items required multiple clicks to get a response. The graphics are very poor even on high settings and on a high end machine. The trees and bushes aren't so much blowing in the wind as shaking and what is wrong with the sea with its dayglow blue colour and triangular mist. I know this is an early access game but for me this is too early in its production and it has too many issues. I will keep an eye on this title as it might turn out to be ok. This has been my first purchase of an early access game and it has put me off future purchases. I'll wait for the finished product from now on.
I've asked for a refund which is something I never thought I'd ever say about a Steam purchase.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Good idea but Messy finalization
First of all i want to start by saying that the game is still in early access and the developers are planning to work it on till end of 2016, wich means they still have over a full year to fix all the issues and polish the game.

Graphics:
From images and reviews the graphics seem to look good, but i myself have done 3D modelling for around 5 years and it seems like the game has a small normal mapping issue or something similar since everything is really shiny, even objects indoors that should not have any shine to them looks like someone is pointing a flashlight at them. Most of the textures ingame seem too simple, often either 1 single texture tiled over the entire models like tables or chairs makes it look little lazy, but they are still working on it so i hope these are just placeholders. Im also not too keen to the level desing since lot of the places dont have too much detail on them.

Sound:
The game seems to lack sounds as it doesent seem to have music at all

Bugs and optimization:
The game doesent seem too bad at first but once i managed to get to the second area (Forest) my framerate dropped to 15fps, now i have a fairly powerfull system running on GTX970 but the game still seemes to struggle to keep it decent, even when i set everyting to Low" the framerate was only 25fps
date:
so framerate seems to be a big issue here. What comes to random bugs i seemed to found a weird one where you walk into a sign and it launches you 100 feets up in the air. The game also seems to have a really strong motion blur that kind of want to make you vomit after a while but you can always turn it off. When increasing field of View and looking down you can actually see trough your body.

Movement and controls:
The character movement seems little slow and jumping sometimes doesent seem to work and the character jumps backwards in a slow weird manner. The game also features a stamina system that is insanely high
recommended:
meaning you can run probably 15 minutes untill it depletes completely.

World:
Everything seems to look way too shiny to really enjoy the actual visuals but the game seems to give you freedom on where to go
hoursPlayed: alltho it doesent exactly give enough info to understand where your suppose to go
voteText:
making it really disorienting and wanting to just walk aimlessly in the woods and expecting you to just find something to look at.


In all and all the game isint too bad

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game feels like a timemachine, and that's not a compliment. Everything feels like it could have been okay ten years ago, but even then it wouldn't have been a great success.

The combat is one big joke, enemies simply walk at you and when they hit you it doesn't feel like anything happens. The same goes for when you hit them, you just shoot 2 bullets and then reload and after a few times the enemy drops and you continue.

There isn't really a clear path to follow, you just walk into dead ends with a few enemies and a container to loot and you'll have to walk back and find out where to go. Normally finding out where to go and exploring the map can be fun in some games but in this game it just feels like you're wasting your time.

The game supports a controller but even once I put the aiming speed of it at it's maximum it still moved very slowly, which makes the contoller simply unusable. Using the keyboard and mouse does work but still doesn't feel very comfortable.

The game is simply a pain to play and is at it's current state simply not worth playing. There are better alternatives for this price.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Not very good. Floaty jumping; you get stuck and jitter on some scenery, other scenery you can walk right through when you shouldn't be able to. Some nice quality lighting effects sit awkwardly on top of objects which often have an embarassingly low poly count. Often objects look too much like what they are: assets placed in a level.

Maybe I'll try it again another time but for now I gave up in frustration.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Sadly, I must state this game is simply put : not recommended at this point in time.

The environment is pleasant if dated with some exceptions,(One being a notable section in a pond. Very disconcerting being underwater" and having look the same as being above the water.) The visuals reminded me a lot of Myst actually.

Voice work is functional. The dialogue was subpar. (A case in point. The PC swears at an NPC with no real provocation? Just because a request was made? And no other dialogue options for the PC to use if they wanted to negotiate or be more diplomatic?)

Combat and movement are sluggish. Weapons are few
date:
though I understand there are more on the way.

Which brings us sadly to the game's progress. The developers have promised an update which is extremely overdue and communications have been downright glacial. I am actually concerned about this being abandonware. I understand that this is Early Access but that means you need to be more verbal about delays not less.

If you are interested
recommended: I would say wait six months then check and see what has happened. If the project has moved forward
hoursPlayed: then see what is going on in the forum. If it seems genuine forward motion has been made then maybe invest in Avenging Angel. Otherwise
voteText: stay away."
